Zetterstedt, Johan [Janne] Emanuele (1828-1880), Swedish botanist; studied at
Uppsala (1846), Lund (1848) and Uppsala 1848-1850; Dr. phil. Uppsala 1854, habil.
ib. 1855; lecturer in agronomy 1855, in natural history and chemistry at Jönköping's
Teacher's College 1863-1880). (<em>J.E. Zetterst.</em>).

Zetterstedt, Johan Wilhelm (1785-1874), Swedish entomologist and botanist; studied
at Lund 1805-1808; Dr. fil. ib. 1808, Dr. med. h.c. ib. 1868; botanical lecturer ib. 1810,
botanical demonstrator 1812, professor's title 1822; secretary of the University of Lund
1828-1836; professor of botany and agronomy ib. 1839-1853. (<em>J.W. Zetterst.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GB (2000 mosses in gen. herb.; c. 3500 phan. &amp; crypt. partly
coll. by Acharius, Sparrman, Swartz, Thunberg, Westring). – Further material at B
(mainly destr.), LD (musci). – <em>Correspondence</em>: LD-UB; further letters af Göteborgs K.
Vet.-Vitt.-Samhälle.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 540; BM 5: 2389; Bossert p. 449; CSP 6: 503;
GR p. 504; Jackson p. 445; Kleppa p. 236; KR p. 783-784 (b. 20 Mai 1785, d. 23 Dec
1874); PR 10476-10479, ed. 1: 11433-11436; Rehder 5: 940; TL-2/9090; Urban-Berl. p.
412.

Zeyher, Carl Ludwig Philipp (1799-1858), German (Hessen) plant collector; with F.
Sieber to Mauritius 1822 and (without Sieber) at the Cape of Good Hope 1822-1823;
collecting alone in S. Africa 1825-1828, in collaboration with C.F. Ecklon 1829-1838; in
the interior of South Africa with John Burke 1842-1843; in Namaqualand 1843; in
London and Hamburg 1843-1847; botanist at the botanical garden at the Cape 1849-
1851. (<em>Zeyh</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: SAM. – Further material (see also IH 2: 176) in A, AWH, B
(mainly destr.), BHU, BM, BR, C, CAS, CGE, DBN, DS, E, FI, FR, G, GE, GH,
GOET, GRA, GZU, H (300), HAL, HBG, K, KIEL, L, LE, LIVU, LZ, M, MANCH,
MO, MW, NBG, NCY, O, OXF, P, PC, PH, PR, PRE, S, SAM, STE, US, W, WRSL,
WU. – <em>Letters</em> at K.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 3: 568, 5(1): 408; Barnhart 3: 540; BM 2: 504, 5:
2389; Clokie p. 161-162, 268-269; Herder p. 158, 217; Hortus 3: 1207; IH 1 (ed. 2): 17,
(ed. 3): 18, (ed. 6): 366, (ed. 7): 344, 2: 176; Lasègue p. 588 [index]; PR (alph.) 2610,
ed. 1: 2901; Rehder 1: 494; TL-1/331, see C.F. Ecklon; TL-2/1621, 4038, 5925, see

p. 746, 839.

Zeyher, Johann Michael (1770-1843), German (Bavarian) botanist and horticulturist;
educated at Ansbach (Bavaria), spent some time in Basel; head-gardener at the garden
of the grand-duke of Baden at Schwetzingen 1804, director ib. 1806-1843. (<em>J. Zeyh.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: KR (fide Lasègue p. 461). – A considerable number of plants
collected by him (or by others for him) in southern France, the Eastern Pyrenees, N.
America and Sicily at UPS-Thunb. Other material at H (as in UPS-Thunb.), FR,
REG(?). – <em>Letters</em> to Steudel at UPS-UB (fide Lack &amp; Sydow), further letters at G. – See
also Götz 1984.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 3: 568, 5(1): 408; Backer p. 634; Barnhart 3: 540 (b.
26 Nov 1770, d. 20 Apr 1843); BM 5: 2389; Frank 3 (Anh.): 116; Herder p. 168; Jackson
p. 431; Lasègue p. 333, 461 (all locations mentioned for J.M. and not for C.L.P.
Zeyher?); PH 438; PR 10485-10487, ed. 1: 11437-11439; Rehder 1: 45; TL-2/see C.P.
Thunberg; Tucker 1: 758.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 8: 34. 1860; Bot. Zeit. 1: 440, 520. 1843 (d.); Flora 26(1):
	293. 1843 (d.), 26(2): 572 (herb. acquired by the Grand-Duke of Baden; will be
	located in Karlsruhe), p. 673-681 (obit. from Karlsruher Zeitung). 1855.
Barnhart, J.H., Bartonia 16: 36. 1934.
Götz, H., Gartendirektor Johann Michael Zeyher, Schwetzingen 1984, 145 p. (biogr.,
	portr., corr., bibl.).
Ilg, W., Hoppea 42: 100. 1984 (possibly confused with C.L.P. Zeyher or plants stemm-
	ing from the latter through the former).
Lack, H.W. &amp; C.-O. von Sydow, Willdenowia 14: 446. 1984 (letters to Steudel and
	Lehmann at UPS-UB).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: For the family relationship see Götz (1984, p. 7: J.M. Zeyher was a grandson of
Johann Leonhard Z., C.L.P. Zeyher a great grandson of the same; C.L.P. Zeyher's
grandfather was a brother of J.M.'s father).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Zeyheria</em> C.F.P. Martius (1826); <em>Zeyheria</em> A. Sprengel (1828).

Ziegenspeck, Hermann [Robert Theodor] (1891-1959), German (Bavarian) bota-
nist and pharmacist; studied at Jena; Dr. phil. 1916; Pharmac. State Exam. 1919; Habil.
Königsberg 1925; lecturer and assistant with C. Mez at the Botanical Institute of the
University of Königsberg i. Pr. 1924-1932; pharmacist at Augsburg 1932-1944, in
Kötzting 1944-1949; from 1949 again at Augsburg. (<em>Ziegensp</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Destroyed in 1944. – <em>Letters</em> in G.

Zillig, Hermann (1893-1952), German (Franconian) botanist and phytopathologist;
studied at the University of Würzburg 1912-1915; on active service 1915-1918; studying
meteorology 1919-1920; assistant at the Botanical Institute of Würzburg 1920-1921; Dr.
phil. 1920; with the Biologische Reichsanstalt für Land- und Forstwirtschaft at Trier
1921-1926, at Bernkastel-Kues 1926-1952. (<em>H. Zillig</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – <em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Ustilagineen Europas</em>, Lief. 1-14, nos. 1-140,
Trier 1925-1935. Sets at B (extant), BPI, CUP, FH, G, H, UPS, W. – Nos. 1-40 ment-
ioned in Hedwigia 11 Jun 1925, 41-70. 11 Jan 1926, 71-100. Mai 1927, 101-120, rd. FH
Jun 1932, 121-140. 25 Jan 1935 (Hedwigia). See D.H. Pfister (1985). – A series <em>Ustila-
gineae of North America</em> was never issued (see Stevenson 1971, p. 528).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 541 (b. 21 Apr 1893); BFM 1332; Biol.-
Dokum. 19: 10311-10312; Kelly p. 244-245; LS suppl. 30875-30891; TL-2/12.459.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Degener, H.A.L., Wer ist's ed. 10. 1785-1786. 1935.

... 1932, cover-t.p., p. [134]-281. <em>Copy</em>: G.

Zimmermann, [Philipp Wilhelm] Albrecht (1860-1931), German (Braunschweig)
botanist; studied natural sciences at Tübingen, Berlin, Würzburg and Leipzig; Dr. phil.
Leipzig 1881; assistant with Schwendener at the Berlin Institute for plant physiology
1881-1883 and with L. Kny at the botanical Institute of the Berlin Agricultural College
1883-1884; lecturer at the University of Leipzig 1885; id. Tübingen 1888, e.o. professor
of botany ib. 1894; habil. Berlin 1895 and lecturer ib.; botanist at the Coffee culture
experiment station at Buitenzorg, Java 1896; botanist and asst. director at the
biological-agronomical institute at Amani (E. Africa) 1902-1920; professor of botany at
the Forestry College Hann. Münden 1921, director of the botanical laboratory of the

PAGE: 539
HEADING: A. ZIMMERMANN

Biological State Institute for Agriculture and Forestry, Berlin-Dahlem 1922-1925; in
retirement continuing his work on colonial botany. (<em>A. Zimmerm.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Material in B (mainly destr.), BM, MO. – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 634; Barnhart 3: 541 (b. 3 Apr 1860, d. 23 Feb
1931); BJI 1: 65, 2: 197; BM 5: 2391, 8: 1475; Bossert p. 449; CSP 11: 886; Hirsch p.
334; Lipschitz 14.298, 29.575-29.594, 40.830-40.838a; Moebius p. 171, 458 [index];
Rehder 5: 940-941; SBC p. 1263; SK 1: 591; TL-2/10.562; Tucker 1: 758, 3: 345;
Urban.-Berl. p. 284, 412.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 49: 83. 1931 (d.); Bot. Centralbl. 21: 192. 1885
	(habil. Leipzig), 34: 32. 1888 (asst. Tübingen), 59: 255. 1894 (e.o. prof. bot. Tübin-

Zimmermann, Johann Georg von (1728-1795), Swiss physician and botanist;
studied medicine in Göttingen and Bern; practicing physician; royal physician at Han-
nover 1768, later also in St. Petersburg and Potsdam, at the same time writer on polit-
ical, social and philosophical issues. (<em>J.G. Zimmerm.</em>).

Zimmermann, Walter [Max] (1892-1980), German (Baden) botanist; studied
natural sciences in Karlsruhe, Freiburg, Berlin, München; Dr. phil. Freiburg i. Br. 1921;
private lecturer Tübingen 1925; assistant professor ib. 1929-1959; military service 1910-
1911, active service 1914-1919, 1939-1945; full professor (emeritus) Tübingen 1959-
1980; outstanding phylogeneticist and botanist; originator of the "Telomtheorie". (<em>W.
Zimmerm.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: TUB (until 1958 at least, private). - Further material in E.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 541 (b. 9 Mai 1892); BFM 2259, 2309,
2310a; Biol.-Dokum. 19: 10329-10330; BJI 2: 197; Bossert p. 450; Hirsch p. 339;
Moebius p. 124; TL-2/1949, 2571, 16.031, 16.041; Tucker 3: 345.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Hedwigia 78: (75). 1938 (prof. bot. Hohenheim) Österr. bot. Z. 87: 80.
	1938 (ord. prof. bot. Agric. Coll. Hohenheim, Stuttgart) [retained Tübingen
	position]; Taxon 29: 701. 1980 (d. 30 Jun 1980).
Daber, R., Gleditschia 9: 321-324. 1982 (obit., portr.).

	767. 1980 (obit.).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) Outside our period e.g. <em>Geschichte der Pflanzen</em>, Stuttgart 1949, xi, 111 p.; ed. 2.
1969; <em>Evolution und Naturphilosophie</em>, Berlin 1969, 313 p.
(2) Walther Zimmermann (1890-1945), German (Baden) botanist, published on the
variability of German orchids.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Zimmermannioxylon</em> K.U. Leistikow (1962) <em>Note</em>: <em>Zimmermannia</em> W. Gothan et F.
Zimmermann (1932) probably honors the German geologist Ernst H. Zimmermann
(1860-x); <em>Zimmermannitheca</em> W. Remy et R. Remy (1959) was probably named for Franz
Zimmermann, 20th century German paleobotanist.

Zinn, Johann Gottfried (1727-1759), German (Franconian) physician and botanist;
studied at Göttingen; Dr. med. 1749; in Berlin 1749-1753; e.o. professor of pharma-
cology and director of the botanical garden of Göttingen 1753, ord. prof. 1755. (<em>Zinn</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some plants at LINN. Although the collections of Zinn may be
expected to be at GOET, Dr. H.J. Beug kindly informed us that he failed to trace them.
They may be among the anonymous eighteenth century collections, but there are no
signs of any annotations by Zinn, neither have any manuscripts been traced. Further
material in B (mainly destr.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 45: 336; Backer p. 635; Barnhart 3: 542 (b. 4 Dec
1727, d. 6 Apr 1759); BM 5: 2393; Bossert p. 450; Dryander 3: 79, 118, 159, 231, 329,
409, 417, 421; Frank 3 (Anh.): 116; Hegi 6(1): 527; Herder p. 154; Hortus 3: 1207;
Jackson p. 426; MW p. 549; PR 10502-10503; Rehder 1: 44, 142; RS p. 149; SO 637e;
TL-1/1446-1447; Tucker 1: 759; Urban-Berl. p. 412; Zander ed. 10, p. 735, ed. 11, p.
839.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 263: 650-651. 1966.
Arnim, M., Mitgl.-Verz. Ges. Wiss. Göttingen 1751-1929. 186. 1928.

Zittel, Karl Alfred [von] (1839-1904), German (Baden) palaeontologist; studied at
the University of Heidelberg 1857-1861; at Paris 1861-1862; volunteer with the Geolog-
ical Survey of Austria 1863; habil. Univ. Vienna 1863; professor of mineralogy at
Karlsruhe 1863-1866; professor of palaeontology at München 1866, from 1890 also
keeper of the Bavarian State Geological Collection. (<em>Zitt</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Andrews p. 354; Barnhart 3: 542; BJI 1: 65; BM 5: 2394-
2395, 8: 1475–1476; Herder p. 347, 354; Jackson p. 178; Merrill p. 376, 379; Quenstedt
p. 475 (b. 25 Sep 1839, d. 5 Jan 1904); SIA see index; TL-2/2838, 9454, 9455, 10.567,
see indexes; Tucker 1: 759.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Quart. J. Geol. Soc. London 60: lv-lix. 1904 (obit.); Bot. Centralbl. 81:
	415. 1900 (Acad. Sci. Paris); Nat. Nov. 17: 334. 1895 (Akad. Berlin), 26: 130. 1904
	(d.).
Barrois, C, Bull. Soc. géol. France ser. 4. 4: 488-493. 1904 (obit.).
Branco, W., Z. deut. geol. Ges. 56: 1-7. 1904 (obit.).
Jaekel, O., Naturw. Wochenschr. ser. 2. 3: 359-361. 1904 (obit.).
Kitchin, F.L., Geol. Mag. 476: 90-96. 1904 (obit., portr., bibl.).
Klautsch, A., Naturw. Rundschau, Wöchtenl. Ber. 19(5): 65-66. 1904 (obit.).
Nissen, C, Zool. Buchill. 443. 1969.
Pomepckj, J.F., Palaeontographica 50: 1-28. 1904 (biogr., portr.).
Schuchert, Ch., Ann. Rep. Smiths. Inst. 1904: 779-786. 1905 (obit., portr., partly transl.
	from Pomepckj (1904).
Schwarzbach, M., Auf den Spuren uns. Naturforscher 22, 71, 80, 81. 1981.

Zmuda, Antoni Jozef (1889-1916), Polish botanist; botanical assistant in Krakow.
(<em>Žmuda</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: KRA, KRAM. Some further material (sometimes probably

Zobel, August (1861-1934), German (Prussian) botanist at Dessau; studied at a
teacher's seminary at Osterburg (Altmark); first teacher's exam. 1881; teacher at
Wolfsburg 1881-1884, at Loedderitz 1884-1885; second teacher's exam. 1885; teacher
and cantor at Güntersberge 1885-1900; high school teacher at Dessau 1900-1923.
(<em>Zobel</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Dessau (Museum für Naturkunde und Vorgeschichte), see O.
Voigt 1979. - Some further material in E (in Kneucker, <em>Carices exs</em>.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 5(1): 75, 12(2): 754; Barnhart 3: 543 (b. 21 Dec
1861, d. 28 Oct 1934); BFM 414; Biol.-Dokum. 19: 10343; BJI 2: 197; Hegi 6(2): 1295.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Fuess, W., Mitt. Thür. bot. Ver. ser. 2. 42: iii-v. 1935 (obit.).
Kobert, K. &amp; W. Fuess, Ber. naturw. Ver Mus. Naturk. Vorgesch. Dessau 4: 3-5. 1937
	(obit.).
Voigt, O., Mitt. Flor. Kart. Halle 5(1): 20-28. 1979 (on herb. Zobel at Dessau).

Phan.</em>).

Zodda, Giuseppe (1877-1968), Italian botanist; studied at the University of Messina;
assistant for botany ib. 1900-1908; at Catania 1909; teacher at the Technical School of

PAGE: 549
HEADING: ZOHARY

Messina 1909; subsequently at Portici, Potenza, Mantova, Napoli, Siracusa, Bari, finally
president of the Istituto Tecnico at Teramo 1932-1947. (<em>Zodda</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Material at BI, E, NAP (Hepat.), TENN (3500 bryo.).

Zohary, (né Schein) Michael (1898-1983), Polish (Galicia)-born Israeli botanist; mi-
grated to Palestine 1920; Dr.phil. Praha 1936; with the Hebrew University 1926-1967;
in retirement continuing his botanical work. (<em>Zoh</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HUJ. - Further material in BM, C, CAIM, GB, GH. - <em>Exsic-
catae</em>: (with N. Feinbrun) <em>Flora exsiccata Palestinae. - Letters</em> at G.

Roon p. 127.

Zollikofer, Caspar Tobias (1774-1843), Swiss physician, botanist and entomologist;
studied medicine in Zürich, Halle a.S. and Edinburgh; Dr. med. Halle 1794; admini-
strator in St. Gallen 1797-1802; practicing physician and pharmacist ib. from 1802.
(<em>Zollik</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Nat. Hist. Mus. St. Gallen. Further material in BR. For his
drawings see C. Bächler (1945). - <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 543 (b. 15 Mai 1774, d. 6 Dec 1843); BM 5:
2395; CSP 6: 516; Herder p. 181; Jackson p. 343; NI 2201, see indexes; PR 10504, ed. 1:
11461; Rehder 1: 433.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Attinger, V. et al., Dict. hist. biogr. Suisse 7: 452. 1933.
Bächler, E., Ber. Tätigkeit St. Gallen naturw. Ges. 71: 1-43. 1945 (portr., biogr. sketch;
	on water paintings and drawings).

	watercolors).
Meyer, D., Verh. schweiz. naturf. Ges. 29: 238-255. 1845 (obit.).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Zollikoferia</em> C.G.D. Nees (1825); <em>Zollikoferia</em> A.P. de Candolle (1838).

	dupl.).

Zollinger, Heinrich (1818-1859), Swiss botanist; school teacher at Küssnacht 1836-
1837; studied at Genève 1837 (with e.g. Alph. de Candolle); high school teacher at
Horgen 1838 and Herzogenbachsee 1840; sent out on a botanical expedition to Java by
Alph. de Candolle and others 1841-1844; working at the herbarium of de Candolle
1845; in Sumatra and Java again 1845-1848; director of a seminary at Horgen, Switzer-
land 1848-1854; again in Java 1855-1859. (<em>Zoll</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: P, PC (largest series through Franqueville) (set used by F.A.W.
Miquel for his Flora indiae batavae). Other material at A, B (mainly destr.), BASSA,
BERN, BM, BR (impt.), CGE, CORD, DPU, F, FI, G, GH, GOET, H-Nyl, K, KIEL
(destr.), L, LAU, LE, LZ (destr.), M, MICH, MW, NEU, S, W, WRSL. - Zollinger's
collections were distributed in part as <em>Plantae javanicae</em> 1843-1847 (3605 nos. plus 1604
unicates), <em>Plantae japonicae</em> 1847 (641 nos.).- <em>Letters</em> to F.A.W. Miquel at U; to Halácszy
and Keck at UPS-UB; other letters at G. - <em>Manuscript diaries</em>: Zentralbibliothek Zürich.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 45: 419-423; AG 6(2): 56; Backer p. 635-636;
Barnhart 3: 543 (b. 22 Mar 1818, d. 19 Mai 1859); BM 5: 2395-2396; Bossert p. 450;
CSP 6: 517-518, 8: 1306, 12: 805; De Toni 4: lxv; GR p, 636, cat. p. 74; Herder p. 214,
292, 336; Hortus 3: 1207; IF p. 738; JW 4: 414; Lasègue p. 269, 307, 506, 556; LS
29619-29620; MW p. 549; PR 5262, 6470, 10505, ed. 1: 7205; Rehder 5: 941; SBC p.
135; SK 1: xxix, clii, 593-596 (detailed info.), 4: clxi, 5: cccxxxvi, 8: cxi; TL-1/238, 893,

PAGE: 551
HEADING: ZOLLINGER

1448; TL-2/1121, 6339, 15.336, see indexes; Tucker 1: 759; Urban-Berl. p. 284, 292,
318, 412; Zander ed. 10, p. 735, ed. 11, p. 839.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 1: 102. 1853 (in Paris and Holland), 2: 284 (broke a leg at
	Cairo), 3: 63 (from Cairo to Küssnacht for healing), 206 (Z. in Leipzig), 208 (will
	leave for Java) 1855, 7: 278. 1859 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 1: 248. 1843 (coll. from Java), 2:
	128. 1844 (note by Moritzi on coll.), 13: 144. 1855 (to Java), 615. 1855 (definitely to
	Java after having been back to Switzerland from Cairo for health reasons); Bull.
	Koloniaal Mus. 33: 109-110. 1905 (Zollinger's grave in good order at Sendoero);
	Flora 27(1): 1-75. 1844 (distr. coll.), 42: 748. 1859 (d.); Gartenflora 3: 307. 1854
	(again to Java), 4: 44. 1855 (back to Europe, from Cairo again at Küssnacht), 4: 244
	(definitely to Java), 6: 64. 1857 (definitely in Java).
Briquet, J., Bull. Soc. bot. Suisse 50a: 484-487. 1940 (biogr., bibl., epon., coll.).
Frodin, D.G., Guide standard floras world. S 91-93. 1985.

	[<em>1</em>]: 1844, <em>in</em> 1: [372]-405. 1844.

HEADING: ZOLLINGER

	[<em>3</em>]: 1845, <em>in</em> 2: [1]-19- 1845.

18.718. <em>Verslag van eene reis naar Bima en Soembawa</em>, en naar eenige plaatsen op Celebes,
Saleijer en Floris, gedurende de maanden Mei tot December 1847, ... [Batavia 1850].
Qu. (<em>Versl. reis Bima</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1850, err. slip, p. [1]-224, 10 p. lists, <em>1 pl. Copies</em>: G, HH, LC. - Issued as Verh.
	Bat. Gen. Kunst. Wet. [Batavia] 23. 1850.

18.719. <em>Systematisches Verzeichniss</em> der im indischen Archipel in den Jahren 1842-1848
gesammelten sowie der aus Japan empfangenen Pflanzen. Herausgegeben von H.
Zollinger ... Zürich (Druck und Verlag von E. Kiesling) 1854-1855, 3 Hefte. Oct. (<em>Syst.
Verz.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1854-1855, 3 Hefte. <em>Copies</em>: G, HH, L, MO, NY, USDA; IDC 5823.
	<em>1</em>: Jun 1854, p. [i*, t.p. for I. und 2. Heft"], [i, t.p., Heft 1]-xii, [1]-80.
	<em>2</em>: Nov 1854-Jan 1855, p. [i-iii, incl. t.p. "2. Heft"], [81]-160, <em>1 pl</em>. (p.p. col. lith.),
	[cover Heft 1 states "Das zweite Heft erscheint im Verlauf des Monats August"].
	<em>3</em>: Apr-Dec 1855, p. [1]-66, [67, err.].
	<em>Note</em> (<em>1</em>): The above dates are based on the correspondence between Zollinger and
	Miquel (U-UB).
	"In meiner Abwesenheit [early Jun-4 Oct 1854] wurde die zweite Lieferung meines
Kataloges vollendet, scheusslich entstellt von Druckfehlern" (3 Feb 1855). Zollinger
then added four pages of corrections; p. 156 is dated Nov 1854. Various groups were
treated by specialists. Miquel did most of the Monochlamydeae. Choisy did the Convol-
vulaceae, Symplocos, Ternstroemiaceae, Clusiaceae and Hypericaceae on pp. 127-134,
136 and 142-152. Choisy published a corrected reprint of his contribution under the title
<em>Plantae javanicae</em> ... Genève 1858 (30 pp.). Oct. (TL-2/1858). - See also sub Moritzi for
the first Verzeichniss of Zollinger's plants (1845-1846), TL-2/6339.
	<em>Note</em> (<em>2</em>): For corrections by Zollinger, especially regarding Heft 3, see below <em>Observ.
	bot. nov.</em> 1857.
<em>Ref</em>.: Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Bot. Zeit. 12: 844-848. 1 Dec 1854 (rev. Heft 1), 13:
	281-282. 20 Apr 1855 (rev. Heft 2).
Steenis-Kruseman, M.J. van, Fl. males. Bull. 11: 433. 1955, 26: 2019. 1972.
Stafleu, F.A., Wentia 16: 72. 1966.

PAGE: 553
HEADING: ZOPF

Zopf, [Friedrich] Wilhelm (1846-1909), German (Prussian) botanist; educated as
primary school teacher at Eisleben 1864-1867; attended the Eislebener Gymnasium
1869-1874; studied natural sciences at the University of Berlin 1874-1877; Dr. phil.
Halle 1878; habil. Berlin Univ. and Agric. College 1881; lecturer at Halle 1883-1887;
e.o. professor of botany 1887-1899; professor of botany at Münster 1899-1909. (<em>Zopf</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (herb., exsicc, sample collection). Further material in FH,
HAL, PAV, TUR-V. - See Huneck et al (1973) for the Zopf material at B (extant); a
set of original samples used by Zopf for his chemical research sent to B before 1939, still
in perfect condition. In addition B has also a separate lichen herbarium made by Zopf.
<em>Exsiccatae</em>: Zopf contributed to P. Sydow, <em>Mycotheca marchica</em> (see Sydow), and to V.
Wittrock &amp; O. Nordstedt, <em>Algue aqua dulcis</em>, see under Wittrock.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 112, 182, 236, 321; Barnhart 3: 543 (b. 12
Dec 1846, d. 24 Jun 1909); Biol.-Dokum. 19: 10349-10350; BJI 1: 65, 2: 198; BM 5:
2399; Bossert p. 450; De Toni 1: cxxxvii, 2: cxxiv, cxxv, cxxxi, 4: lxv; DTS 1: 335-336, 3:
liv, 4: xlvi; Frank 3 (Anh.): 116-117; GR p. 55-56, <em>pl</em>. [<em>17</em>], cat. p. 74; Hawksworth p.
187; Herder p. 247, 435; IH 1 (ed. 6): 366, (ed. 7): 346; Jackson p. 157, 169; Kelly p.
245; Kleppa p. 291; Langman p. 291; LS 29621-29686; Moebius p. 71, 74, 75; Morren
ed. 10, p. 13; Nordstedt p. 34; SBC p. 135; Stevenson p. 1263; TL-2/10.561, see P.
Sydow and E.H.G. Ule; Urban-Berl. p. 284, 292.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 30: 368. 1887 (app. Halle), 74: 368. 1898 (temp. ord.
	prof. Halle), 77: 239. 1899 (app. Münster), 105: 448 (Geh. Regierungsrath), 560
	(stipend.). 1907, 111: 240 (d.), 480 (Correns successor). 1909; Bot. Zeit. 45: 342. 1887
	(e.o. prof. Halle), 57: 96. 1899 (app. Münster), 67: 240. 1909 (d.); Brit. Mus. gen. cat.
	print, books 263: 827-828. 1966; Cat. gèn. livr. impr. Bibl. natl. 231: 760-763. 1981;
	Deut. Zeitgenossenlex. 1621. 1905; Nat. Nov. 9: 150. 1887 (app. Halle), 21: 87. (app.
	Münster), 687 (Mez succeeds Z. at Halle; Z. succeeds Brefeld at Münster), 25: 519.
	1903 (rector Univ. Münster), 31: 380. 1909 (d.); Science ser. 2. 30: 82. 1909 (d.).
Bettelheim, A., ed., Biogr. Jahrb. deut. Nekrol. 14: 104*. 1912.
Degener, H.A.L., Wer ist's ed. 4. 1609. 1909.
Hiepko, P., Willdenowia 8(2): 392. 1978 (Zopf material extant, B).
Huneck, S. et al., Willdenowia 7(1): 31-45. 1973 (on lichen samples collection at B,
	extant).
Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 4(2): 1694. 1904, 5: 1413. 1926.
Prescott, G.W., Bibl. Desmid. univ. 573. 1984.
Tobler, W., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 27: (58)-(72). 1909 (obit., portr., bibl. 94 nos.).
Zopf, W., Bot. Zeit. 36: 718-719. 1878 (collection of preparations of fungi [models]
	available).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: Contributed to A. Schenk, ed., <em>Handb. Bot.</em> 3(1): 1-97. 1883 (Spalt-
pilze), 3(2): 1-174. 1884 (Mycetozoa, Myxomycetes), 4: 271-756. 1890 (<em>Pilze</em>), see TL-
2/10.561.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Zopfia</em> Rabenhorst (1874); <em>Zopfiella</em> G. Winter (1887). <em>Note</em>: <em>Zopfinula</em> Kirsch-
stein (1939) probably honors F.W. Zopf, but Kirschstein gave no etymology for the
generic name.

der philosophischen Facultät der vereinigten Friedrichs-Universität Halle-Wittenberg
sammt den Thesen öffentlich vertheidigen wird am 12. März 1878, Vormittags 12 Uhr

Zorn, Johannes (1739-1799), German (Bavarian) pharmacist at Kempten. (<em>Zorn</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. - Some vascular plants from the Carolinas and
Jamaica listed for the Herb. Schweinitz at PH by Mears (Zorn did not travel to these
areas).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 636; Barnhart 3: 543; BM 1: 37, 5: 2400;
Dryander 3: 460; DU 335; GF p. 81; Herder p. 414; Jackson p. 200; MW p. 549; NI
2202-2205; Plesch p. 466; PR 10507, 10726, ed. 1: 11463; Rehder 5: 941; SO add. 646c,
646d, 985; Sotheby 829-832; TL-1/1449-1452; Tucker 1: 45, 759.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Hein, W.H. &amp; H.D. Schwarz, Deut. Apoth. Biogr. 2: 785-786. 1978 (b. 22 Oct
	1739, d. 9 Jan 1799).
Mac Gillavry, D., Ned. kruidk. Arch. 53: 71. 1943 (note on <em>Icon. pl. med.</em>).
Mayer, G., <em>in</em> Das schöne Allgäu 39: 61-63. 1976 (n.v.; on his nat. hist. coll.).
Mears, J., Proc. Acad. nat. sci. Philadelphia 133: 165. 1981 (vascular plants from Carol-
	inas, Jamaica in PH [possibly Jacquin material]).
Meusel, J.G., Lexik. teut. Schriftst. 15: 467. 1816.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Zornia</em> Moench (1794). <em>Note</em>: <em>Zornia</em> J.F. Gmelin (1792) was probably also
named for this author but derivation was not given.

18.747. <em>Icones plantarum medicinalium</em> Centuria I [-VI]. Abbildungen von Arzneygewäch-
sen ... Nürnberg (auf Kosten der Raspischen Buchhandlung) 1779 [-1790]. 6 vols. Oct. (<em>Icon. pl. med.</em>).

<em>Ed</em>. [1]: 1779-1790, of which at any rate vols. 1 and 2 were published in two parts. The
	preface to vol. 2 is signed by J. Zorn. <em>Copies</em>: BR, HH, MO, NY.
	<em>1</em>: 1779 (part 1, <em>50 pl</em>. NZgS 3 Mai 1779; part 2, <em>50 pl</em>. NZgS 18 Nov 1779); engraved
	frontisp., (portr. Linnaeus), p. [i-vi], [1]-60, [61-64], [i-iv], <em>pl. 1-100</em> (col. copp. B.
	Thanner).
	<em>2</em>: 1780 (part 1, <em>50 pl</em>., NZgS 18 Mai 1780), p. [i-viii], 65-124 [i-iv incompl.], <em>pl. 101</em>-
	<em>200</em>. The copy at HH has an index to all <em>100 pl</em>., p. 105-132.
	<em>3</em>: 1781, p. [i-vi], 125-204,) <em>pl</em>. <em>201-300</em>. - Some copies (e.g. BR) have a t.p. dated 1786,
	evidently of ed. 2, although not so marked, and with text.
	<em>4</em>: 1782, p. [i], 205-274, <em>pl. 301-400.
	5</em>: 1785 (dated 1784 on t.p., p. iv: 31 Mar 1785), p. [i], 275-336, [337-368, index
	gen.], <em>pl. 401-500.
	6</em>: 1790 (although called Centuria vi, de facto a supplement), p. [1]-76, <em>pl. 501-600</em>
	[the index gen., 32 p. sometimes also bound with this volume].

PAGE: 557
HEADING: ZORNOW

<em>Ed. 2</em>: 1784-1790. <em>Copies</em>: BR, MO.
	1: 1784, frontisp., p. [i], <em>pl. 1-100.
	2</em>: 1784, p. [i], <em>pl. 101-200.
	3</em>: 1786, p. [i], <em>pl. 201-300.
	4</em>: 1787, p. [i], 205-274. <em>pl. 301-400</em> (not identified as ed. 2, has text, dated 1787; <em>copy</em>:
	NY).
	<em>5</em>: 1785 [dated 1784] evidently identical with ed. 1, vol. 5.
	<em>6</em>: 1790, evidently identical with ed. 1, vol. 6.
<em>Dutch edition</em>: 1794-1801, 6 vols. <em>Copy</em>: U. - Texts written by D.L. Oskamp (vol. 1), M.
	Houttuyn (vols. 2-3), J.C. Kraus (vols. 4-6). - <em>Afbeeldingen der Artseny-Gewassen</em> met
	derzelven beschryvingen. Icones plantarum officinalinum ... Amsterdam (J.C. Sepp
	en Zoon), (<em>Afb. Arts.-Gew.</em>).
	<em>1</em>: 1794 (date on t.p., which has "Eerste Deel. Eerste Stukje", preface, dated 15 Oct
	1794, mentions that four parts (of <em>25 pl</em>. each) are planned to constitute a volume.
	Mac Gillavry (1943) gives dates for vols. 4 and 6 which indicate that he had
	further information; we, however, have not traced his sources), p. [i*], engr. t.p., p.
	[i]-iv, ix-xvi, [1]-102, [1-4, index], <em>pl. 1-100</em> (coll. copp.).
	<em>2</em>: 1796, p. [i], engr. t.p., p. [iii-vi], [1]-101, [1-4], <em>pl. 101-200.
	3</em>: 1796, p. [i], engr. t.p., p. [iii-vii], [1]-101, [no index], <em>pl. 201-300.
	4</em>: 1798-1800 (t.p. 1800; p. ii: 1 Aug 1798), p. [i*], engr. t.p., p. [i]-ii, [1-4 index], [1
	list subscr.], [1]-400, <em>pl. 301-400.
	5</em>: 1800, p. [i], engr. t.p., p. [1-4, index], [1]-100, <em>pl. 401-500.
	6</em>: 1800-1801 (engr. t.p. 1800, p. iv: 1 Aug 1801), p. [i*], engr. t.p., p. [i]-iv, [1]-100,
	<em>pl. 501-600</em>, [1]-36 index.
<em>Vervolg</em> [Supplement]: 1813, Amsterdam (Sepp en Zoon) mentioned by Mac Gillavry,
	not seen by us).

18.748. <em>Dreyhundert auserlesene amerikanische Gewächse</em> nach Linneischer Ordnung ...
Nürnberg (auf Kosten der Raspischen Buchhandlung) 1785-1788, 6 vols. Oct. (<em>Drey-
hund. amer. Gew.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1785-1788. <em>Copies</em>: BR, L, MO, NY, U, US. The t.p.'s of the last 5 volumes all
	have as title <em>Amerikanische Gewächse</em>. the volumes are numbered "Erstes hundert, erste
	Hälfte", "id. zwote Hälfte" etc. The plants are mainly [256] from N.J. Jacquin's
	<em>Select, stirp. amer. hist.</em> 1763, 1780-1781, TL-2/3243, 3249.
	<em>1</em>(<em>1</em>): 1785, p. [1]-15, <em>pl. 1-50.</em>

	[rare] and an unnumbered plate of Ranunculus bellidiflorus) are hand coloured

Zschacke, [Georg] Hermann (1867-1937), German botanist and high school teacher;
studied at the Teachers College of Köthen; teacher's exam. Dessau 1889; junior high
school teacher's exam. Magdeburg 1892; at Zerbst 1887-1892, at Hecklingen 1892-1898;
from 1898-1924 at a Girl's high school in Bernburg; in captivity 1914-1916; in Davos
1916-1917. (<em>Zsch</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (herb., extant); further material in Dessau (lich. and moss
coll.), DI (Corsican lich.), H (lich.), M (lich.), TUR-V (lich.). - <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 5(1): 81, 5(2): 441; Barnhart 3: 543 (b. 27 Mai 1867,
d. 19 Sep 1937); Biol.-Dokum. 19: 10354; CSP 19: 802; DTS 1: 336; GR p. 56, <em>pl</em>. [17],
cat. p. 74; LS 40857-40858, suppl. 30947-30956; SBC p. 135; Urban-Berl. p. 292.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Ann. bryol. 12: viii. 1939 (d.).

	portr.); Herzogia 1: 173-176. 1969.
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 4(3): 262. 1938.

Zuccagni, Attilio (1754-1807), Italian physician and botanist; director of the Giardino
dei semplici, Firenze, and director of the Museo di físico e storia naturale, Firenze; made
a trip to Spain and Portugal. (<em>Zuccagni</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Originally at FI. When Parlatore arrived at Florence in 1842 he
found the Zuccagni herbarium destroyed by insects and without indications of localities;
he threw the remnants away. – Some plants collected by Z. in UPS-Thunb. – <em>Letters</em> at
G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 3: 223; Backer p. 636; Barnhart 3: 544 (b. 10 Jan
1754, d. 21 Oct 1907); BM 5: 2400; Bossert p. 451; Dryander 3: 563, 5: 77; Hortus 3:
1207; Jackson p. 433; Lasègue p. 462; PR 10510-10514, ed. 1: 11467-11471; Rehder 5:
942; Saccardo 1: 177, 2: 116, cron. p. xxxvii; TL-1/1452; TL-2/9400, see C.P.
Thunberg; Zander ed. 10, p. 735, ed. 11, p. 839.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Cat. gén. livr. impr. Bibl. natl. 231: 979. 1981.
Bardi, G. d., [Elogia del professore Attilio Zuccagni], Ann. Mus. imp. Fis. Stor. nat.
	Firenze 1: 1-16. 1808.
Gager, C.S., Brooklyn Bot. Gard. Rec. 26(3): 243. 1937.
Parlatore, P., Les collections botaniques du Musée royal de physique et d'histoire
	naturelle de Florence 6. 1874 (coll. "eliminated").

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Zuccagnia</em> Cavanilles (1799, <em>nom. cons.</em>); <em>Zuccangnia</em> [sic] Thunberg (1798, <em>nom.
rej.</em>).

Zuccarini, Joseph Gerhard (1797-1848), German (Bavarian) botanist; Dr. med.
Erlangen 1819; professor of botany at a high school in München 1823; e.o. professor of
botany at the University of Landshut 1824-1826, id. at München 1826; ordinary profes-
sor of agronomy and forestry botany 1835. (<em>Zucc</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: M (30.000; acquired 1849; included also the bryophyte herbaria
of F. Döllinger and H.C. Funck); further material in BR, C, F, Fl, G-DC, K, PH.–
<em>Letters</em> to F.A.W. Miquel at U, to Hochstetter at UPS-UB; to A. Gray at GH, to J.
Torrey at NY, to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; further letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 45: 472-474; Backer p. 636; Barnhart 3: 544 (b. 10
Aug 1797, d. 18 Feb 1848); Biol.-Dokum. 19: 10358; BM 5: 2401-2402; CSP 6: 519-520;
DTS 1: 336; Frank 3 (Anh.): 117; Herder p. 127, 133, 168, 190, 337, 382; Hortus 3:
1207; IH 1 (ed. 1): 84, (ed. 2): 106, (ed. 6): 366, (ed. 7): 346; Jackson p. 429; Langman
p. 819; Lasègue p. 115, 332, 527; Lenley p. 473; LS 29689-29690; MW p. 549-550; NI
2206-2207; PR 8673-8674, 10516-10523, ed. 1: 6586, 6604, 9634, 11.472-11.477; Rehder
5: 942; Saccardo 1: 177; TL-1/796, 1228-1229, 1453; TL-2/5519, 10.553, 11.949-11.952,
11.956, 16.392, see indexes; Tucker 1: 759-760; Zander ed. 10, p. 735, ed. 11, p. 839.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 1: 520. 1843 (decoration); Flora 7(2): 575. 1824 (in Bavarian
	mts), 10(1): 176. 1827 (app. München), 14(1): 206. 1831, 18(1): 176, 18(2): 659.

Zukal, Hugo (1845-1900), Austrian high school teacher and botanist; soldier in the
Austrian army 1864-1872; studied at the Trautenau teachers college; teacher at Freu-
denthal and Vienna, ultimately at a women's teachers college; e.o. profesor of phytopat-
hology for forestry at the Vienna agricultural and forestry college (Hochschule für
Bodenkultur) 1898-1900. (<em>Zukal</em>).

Zundel, George [Lorenzo Ingram] (1885-1950), American botanist (mycologist and
plant pathologist); B.S. Utah Coll. 1911; M.S. Cornell 1915; Dr. phil. Yale 1919; in-
structor in horticulture and botany, Utah Coll. 1911-1912; high school teacher Utah
1912-1913; assistant professor of biology Brigham Young College 1915-1917; assistant
pathologist U.S.D.A. 1917-1919; plant pathologist State Coll. Washington 1919-1926; at
Connecticut Experiment Station 1926-1928; assistant professor plant pathology Pennsyl-
vania State College 1928-1947, id. assoc. prof. 1947-1949. (<em>Zundel</em>).

Zwackh-Holzhausen, [Philipp Franz] Wilhelm Ritter von (1825-1903), German
(Baden) botanist (lichenologist), soldier and nobleman of private means. (<em>Zwackh</em>.).

[main] collection was acquired by E.P. Vrang, Fallköpin, Sverige, in 1936. This collec-
tion is at present at S.
<em>Lichenes exsiccati</em>, nos. 1-1177 (1211 nos.), Heidelberg 1850-1894. Sets at DUKE, FH, H,
K, L, M, MSC, MSTR, S, TUR, UPS, VER, W, WRSL. For further details see Sayre
(1969). – <em>Letters</em> to Brotherus (90) at H; other letters at G.

Zycha, Herbert (1903-x), German botanist (mycologist, phytopathologist); Habil.
Hannoversch-Münden 1937; connected with the Biologische Reichsanstalt für Land-
und Forstwirtschaft, Berlin-Dahlem, later (after 1945) with the Biologische Bundesan-
stalt für Land- und Forstwirtschaft, Hannoversch-Münden, Hessen, in charge of the
Institut für Forstpflanzenkrankheiten and, until 1969, extraordinary professor of phyto-
pathology at the University of Göttingen. (<em>Zycha</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – Correspondence with A.F. Blakeslee and Sophia
Satina at FH.
